title: The Divining Rod 2013 Divine Rod Red (Lodi)
description: This medium-bodied wine smells like herbs and flowers, tastes softly fruity, is easy to drink and plummy in flavor.

title: Tedeschi Family 2012 Stargazer Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This is a 100% varietal wine, with a dullness to the nose and a simplicity to the palate that makes it hard to distinguish, the fruit and acidity diluted.

title: L. Tramier & Fils 2014 Marquis de Brim Grande Réserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)
description: There's an initial astringency to the bouquet of this wine, presented in scents of red-cherry skin, apple and raspberry leaf. The palate offers more of the same, with bitter tannins and fruit-skin flavors that lead into a finish reminiscent of oversteeped black tea.

title: Housley's Century Oak 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is an oddly perfumed and puckering wine, with not much to say in the way of fruit, the oak treatment suggestive of oak chips.

title: Château de Saint Martin 2015 No 2 de Saint-Martin Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Lightly spicy, this soft wine has a zesty tang of orange and bright strawberries that are ripe and gently fruity. The wine is open, ready to drink.

title: Belle Made For You NV Red (Vin de France)
description: This blend of 70% Grenache and 30% Carignan is smooth and easy to drink, with friendly aromas and flavors of red cherry and raspberry that are kissed by a hint of mentholated character. The tannins and low and the finish is short; drink up.

title: Pierre Moulin NV Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
description: An assertive medicinal character dominates the bouquet of this wine, with secondary notes of overripe red berries and strawberry. A fruit leather and Jolly Rancher-like quality overwhelms the palate, while the finish is surprisingly sharp and short.

title: Alta Vista 2015 Malbec Rosé (Mendoza)
description: Strained, funky aromas of corn chips don't include much fruit. This is mostly acid on the palate, while it tastes raw, choppy and citric. A tart finish fails to rescue this substandard rosé.

title: Enoteca Five 2012 Instant Gratification Red (California)
description: An obviously smoky, peppery aroma leads to equally smoky, even ashy flavors and a very tannic texture.

title: Jardín de Lúculo 2015 los Bohemios Rosé (Navarra)
description: Stale plum and cherry aromas don't hint at a bright future. Flat, dried-fruit flavors quickly turn bitter. This is already in a declining state, and it's barely spring.

title: García Figuero 2014 Tinto Figuero 4  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Volatile, minty, piercing aromas are hot and devoid of elegance. This reduced, high-acid number is clipped on the palate. Flavors of vinegar, oak and sour plum finish with a covering of unhelpful minty oak.

title: Peltier 2014 Hybrid Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)
description: This wine has herbal, floral aromas and a candied lemon flavor. Medium-bodied, it is fruitier and seemingly sweeter than many of its peers.

title: Tercos 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Rubbery, jammy, unfocused berry aromas are blurry. This feels heavy and low on pulse. Flavors of stewed plum and berry fruits end with a mild, weedy, green note.

title: Cuatro Vacas Gordas 2013 Made From Organically Grown Grapes Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Dilute cherry aromas are not convincing. Wiry on the palate, this tastes like a mix of berry syrup and tomato. A salty, linear finish turns tart to the point of sour.

title: Bodega Renacer 2015 Punto Final Malbec Rosé (Mendoza)
description: Soupy, horsey citrus and red-berry aromas precede a flabby palate with herbal red-berry flavors that upon inspection taste both sugary and green.

title: L'original French Kiss NV Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)
description: Initial medicinal notes of cherry cough syrup partner with scents of cherry Jolly Rancher and red rope licorice. The smooth, slick palate feels overdone, offering more of those sweet red-fruit flavors, but it finishes fast.

title: Layer Cake 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Potent herb aromas and flavors mark this medium-bodied wine. It will need something assertive like pesto pasta to make a good match.

title: El Porvenir 2014 Laborum Single Vineyard Oak Fermented Torrontés (Cafayate)
description: The barn door is open and the horses have left. This is close to DOA, with mushy, weak aromas and flavors, and almost no distinct fruit at any point.

title: Gaucho Andino 2015 Moscatel (Mendoza)
description: Sharp feline and citrus aromas announce an edgy, citric palate. This Moscatel has a lot of Sauvignon character throughout, including flavors of lime, scallion and green herbs. An oily, pithy finish makes for a harsh ending.

title: Le Val 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)
description: Sweet oak aromas of vanilla extract, pencil shaving and cocoa butter flood the nose, overshadowing any pure fruit character. Soft and broad in texture, it has plum spice and sweet wood flavors that fade fast on the close.

title: Peter Cellars 2013 Estate Merlot (Carneros)
description: This wine tastes sweet and grapey, with a softness that becomes cloying and a preponderance of baked flavor.

title: Paul Bouchard & Cie NV White (Vin de France)
description: Faint aromas of melon rind, yellow flower and honeycomb lead into the ripe palate of yellow apple and mealy peach. Pithy citrus notes unfold on the surprisingly bitter finish.

title: Val de Los Frailes 2015 Rosado (Cigales)
description: This red-tinged rosado hits the nose with sharp and herbaceous scents. A drawing palate with sour citrus flaand pyrazines ends equally raw, tart and green.

title: Pampa 2014 Estate Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Rough, grassy aromas and flavors along with a choppy mouthfeel render this one rung above unacceptable. Overall, this is about as raw, punchy, green and herbaceous as a Malbec can get.

title: Moët & Chandon NV MC III Brut  (Champagne)
description: Moët & Chandon's new prestige cuvée is a remarkable blend of three different styles of wine: young and fresh, wood aged and bottle aged. The oldest wine in this blend dates from 1993. It's superb—more wine than bubbles—with a patina of maturity that is also so fresh. Toast and crisp apples make a wonderful pair of flavors. It is complex, ripe and unforgettable.

title: Casa Ferreirinha 2007 Reserva Especial Red (Douro)
description: This Ferreirinha Douro Superior wine is made in exceptional years. The 2007 is the 16th vintage since 1960 (the previous release was 2003). It is an immense wine in its grandeur while being sophisticated and structured. There are complex flavors from the long wood aging. The dark, dense black fruits are impressive while perfectly meshed into the concentrated tannins and black currant acidity. This wine, even at nine years, is young, and should not be drunk before 2020 (or decanted if you can't wait).

title: Merry Edwards 2013 Coopersmith Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From Laguna Ridge Vineyard, which surrounds the producer's winery, this bottling begs to be explored. It's beguiling from the beginning, with unexpected shots of soy, corn nuts and gamy charcuterie. Big, structured tannins support juicy flavors of black cherry and raspberry, resulting in a complex, velvety mouthfeel. Flourishes of dark chocolate and cardamom tease on the finish.

title: Wine & Soul 2013 Pintas Red (Douro)
description: This is the top wine in the Wine & Soul range from Sandra Tavares da Silva and Jorge Serôdio Borges. It is a great wine in every sense, from its power and density to its grace and style. Allied with the black fruits, there are huge tannins and a dark, brooding character that promises long-term aging. Drink from 2020.

title: Castell 2012 Casteller Kugelspiel Eiswein Silvaner (Franken)
description: Luscious honey, marmalade and grapefruit perfume bursts from the glass of this bristling Silvaner eiswein. The palate is almost cloudlike in its delicacy yet lavishly creamy too, dusted by lingering hints of mineral, earth and umami. It's delicious already but structured enough to improve over the next decade.

title: Messias 1963 Colheita Tawny  (Port)
description: This fabulous wine comes from a legendary Vintage Port year. Aged in wood and only bottled in 2015, it is so concentrated and intense. The old gold and wood flavors are dominant in a beautiful wine that may be old but certainly has every possible nuance of flavor. It is one in a succession of rare and treasured Ports that occasionally emerge from Port producers cellars. Drink now.
